content:
Do this:

  1. install the addon, importexporttools NG on both PCs
  2. on pc!, highlight the folder, rightclick and select export mbox
  3. on pc2, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, and select import mbox and select the file created in step 1
  4. repeat for all desired folders.
creator: davidsk

content: Try this: click view>message body as>original HTML
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello David, 

                  Not really, as normally when you click on an email to open and read it also opens Firefox whether it is already loaded or not and displays the HTML page.

I notice others are complaining of similar problems. So hopefully those workers who do so much for us can fix it. I just went back and looked at old emails and there is no url html address as the first line just the name of the company that sent it, The html address was in the 2nd line. It could be that Thunderbird is looking at the wrong line and does not know it is an html page. Wirst possibility is that emails from another server is doing something that is wrong. de Barry
creator: vk2aab

content:
Upgrading to the Release Channel is optional. You'll still get security updates and bug fixes if you don't update. Your existing profiles will work with the Release channel. Consider the following to help you decide.

Release Channel:

- less stable

- newest features

- other improvements, e.g., graphical/functional

Note: some add-ons will not work until they are updated.

Extended Support Release Channel (ESR):

- more stable

- consistent behavior

- low maintenance

- fewer new features

See more details :

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel/

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-release/
creator: siffemoz

content: Try pressing F11 to get to full screen prior to setting the account.
creator: davidsk

content: Please clarify your account setup. Specifying to keep on server applies to POP, yet accessing from multiple devices requires IMAP. Have you logged in online to Yahoo to see if messages are there? If not, then they're only on your PC. Tell us more details. On your question, an IMAP account does keep PC and server in sync, not in Local Folders, but in the account's folders.
creator: davidsk
